Notes: The Blount County Archives, established in 1978, documents the county's development since its formation in 1818.  Holdings consist of approximately 5,000 cubic feet of archival and manuscript material, including land, marriage, estate settlement, tax, and court records dating to the county's origins.  In addition to local government records, the collection includes private manuscripts and artifacts.  The county government records also contain information pertaining to surrounding counties formed out of Blount after 1818.
Source of Repository Data: Alabama Department of Archives and History
